intro: Veyretia szlachetkoana, commonly known as the silverleaf veyretia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or white, with five petals and numerous stamens. Veyretia szlachetkoana is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
